meanings.definition: A skilled writer or creator of words.
meanings.sent1: The wordsmiths crafted beautiful stories that captivated their audience.
meanings.sent2: Many famous authors are known as wordsmiths for their ability to create compelling narratives.
meanings.sent3: The wordsmiths at the publishing house were always busy weaving tales for eager readers.
meanings.sent4: Her pen danced across the paper like a skilled wordsmith painting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The wordsmiths' words were like magic, bringing characters to life in the minds of readers.

meanings.definition: Those who excel at using language effectively.
meanings.sent1: The wordsmiths in the debate club always had the most persuasive arguments.
meanings.sent2: As a poet, she was considered one of the finest wordsmiths of her generation.
meanings.sent3: The wordsmiths in the marketing team knew just how to craft messages that resonated with customers.
meanings.sent4: His speech was so eloquent, he was hailed as a wordsmith among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The wordsmiths' ability to communicate clearly made them invaluable in the business world.
